params.chat_instruct_command:
Continue the chat dialogue below. Write a single reply for the character "<|character|>".

<|prompt|>
params.user_input:
Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

internal:
College A: ```Washington University in St. Louis```
College B: ```Bowdoin College```
Comment: ```@reindeercoffee what country do you currently live in?  Maine and Missouri are definitely different.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

College A: ```University of Michigan```
College B: ```Massachusetts Institute of Technology```
Comment: ```Another vote here for Michigan.  Great school and you’re getting the deal of the century cost-wise.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```University of Richmond```
College B: ```Haverford College```
Comment: ```It sounds like you want Haverford. Maybe you should go with your gut as they are both great schools.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Pomona College```
College B: ```Johns Hopkins University```
Comment: ```I don’t see any “wrong” choice here, not do I see any “perfect” choice.  Pick one and don’t look back.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Vassar College```
College B: ```Kenyon College```
Comment: ```Regarding the statement “heavy drinking is not uncommon at small, rural, isolated colleges.” This is true, however the thing to keep in mind (and look for if you are trying to avoid a school with a party/drinking culture) is does the college provide other opportunities on the weekend AND are they well attended. Kenyon’s plays sell out on Saturday nights, and my daughter has gone to several improv shows. They are standing room only—the students attend these activities! Rocky horror picture show, Harry Potter themed fun, a game of murder mystery held in one of the commons are all activities she has mentioned just in this first semester. Of course many kids go to parties afterward (my daughter usually does one of the two weekend nights) but being an athlete she sometimes turns in early or just hangs out in a friend’s dorm after going to the campus activities. I went to an unranked small catholic college myself, and there were never activities offered on campus like that… or if they were, hardly anyone went. That is the key to look for in my opinion if you have a child who wants to do more than go to parties every weekend. Look to see what the college does offer, AND do the students attend! I tend to think because Kenyon is so rural that administration makes a conscious effort to provide opportunities on the weekends. Schools that have a big city near by often times don’t bother because so many students just leave campus. Another reason that small/rural can contribute to a real sense of community. At least that has been my daughter’s experience so far.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

params.context_instruct:
You will be given two colleges A and B, and a comment. Your job is to identify the preference between the two given colleges in the comment. 
The names of the two colleges and the comment are delimited with triple backticks.

I will ask you the following questions one by one.
1. Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
2. If there is a preference, what is the preference between the two colleges?

Here are the shared rules for both questions:
You MUST NOT use the colleges' real names.
You MUST refer to the colleges as A or B. 
You MUST NOT respond with any other response. 
You MUST NOT make up a preference when there is no preference in the comment.
